definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

sentences.english: When I got there she smiled again, and handed me a boarding pass.
sentences.chinese: 在柜台前她笑容满面地递给我一张登机牌。

sentences.english: Can I see your boarding pass, please?
sentences.chinese: 能给我看一下您的登机牌吗？

sentences.english: Here's your ticket and boarding pass.
sentences.chinese: 这是你的机票和登机牌。

sentences.english: However, be informed however when she conducts boarding check and record without passenger ticket .
sentences.chinese: 然而，当她办理登机牌时却被告知并无客票记录。

sentences.english: You can get the boarding card at the check-in counter over there.
sentences.chinese: 您可以在那边的值机柜台取您的登机牌。

sentences.english: Please prepare the ticket and boarding card well.
Of course, check in before you get to the airport, so that you already have your boarding pass.
sentences.chinese: 当然，在到机场前要登记，确保拥有登机牌。

sentences.english: Excuse me, where is Asiana Airlines's ticketing counter?
sentences.chinese: 请问航空公司的办登机牌柜台在哪里？

sentences.english: Please tell me where to check in for flight to Montego Bay?
sentences.chinese: 请问哪里去换登机牌去蒙特哥湾？

sentences.english: I have reserved the boarding pass for you. You may get it with the receipt of excess baggage.
sentences.chinese: 我已为您留好登机牌，请您交逾重费后凭收据换取。

sentences.english: The manager that still is at that time was helping Deng China gold change boarding check , take the plane on him.
sentences.chinese: 还是当时的经理帮着邓华金换了登机牌，带他上飞机。

sentences.english: All Customers are required to print their boarding pass prior to their scheduled departure.
sentences.chinese: 所有的客户都要求在起飞前打印出他们的登机牌。

sentences.english: The children have a ticket in their boarding pass.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们的机票放在登机牌。

sentences.english: Here is your claim tag and your boarding pass.
sentences.chinese: 这是您的行李牌和登机牌。

sentences.english: And here are your barding passes.

definition: luggage that has been checked in (on flight)
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
to get off a plane/to deplane
to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
